title: At the Moulin Rouge, champagne never stops flowing
summary: Some 250,000 bottles of champagne are consumed every year at the Pigalle cabaret, where 50 waiters serve 900 guests every evening in a ballet that swirls and sparkles just like the stage shows.

title: François Bayrou's failed gamble
summary: In forming his government, France's new prime minister has not succeeded in shifting the lines of the political division resulting from the June parliamentary elections, and finds himself in as uncomfortable a situation as his predecessor, Michel Barnier.

title: After Biden commutes most of federal death row, Trump vows to pursue executions
summary: Trump criticized Biden's decision on Monday. Presidents historically have no involvement in dictating or recommending the punishments that federal prosecutors seek for defendants in criminal cases, though Trump has long sought more direct control over the Justice Department's operations.

title: Syrian authorities say rebel groups have agreed to disband
summary: The country's new authorities announced on Tuesday that they reached an agreement with Syria's rebel groups on their dissolution and integration into the regular defense forces.

title: At Paris's Mamiche bakery, Cécile Khayat and Victoria Effantin bake with a joyful touch
summary: Since 2017, the dynamic, talent-packed duo has been baking breads, pastries and sandwiches in the heart of Paris. The key to their success? 100% homemade products sold in a cheerful, welcoming atmosphere.

title: Five châteaus around Paris to visit with family over the festive season
summary: To attract family audiences, the châteaux of the Ile-de-France region are working overtime on their inventive programming. It is an opportunity to extend Christmas cheer in a majestic setting.

title: On Christmas Eve, Pope Francis launches holy Jubilee year
summary: The ceremony was attended by cardinals and Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni among others, while thousands of people gathered outside in Rome's St. Peter's Square watching on big screens.

title: Nearly two dozen killed in 24 hours in Mozambique after disputed election result
summary: '236 acts of serious violence' were reported across the country, leaving at least 25 people wounded, including 13 police officers, Interior Minister Pascoal Ronda said Tuesday. More than 100 people have already died in the unprecedented post-election violence after Venâncio Mondlane's claim of victory against winner Daniel Chapo.

title: Not much is new about François Bayrou's government
summary: French Prime Minister François Bayrou has appointed experienced political figures, many of whom belong to the former governing coalition. This is as limited a base as that of his predecessor, and does not protect him from a motion of no confidence.

title: Gaza's 500 Christians celebrate second Christmas under bombs
summary: On Sunday, the Holy Family Church received a visit from the Latin Patriarch of Jerusalem, who tried to bring a little hope to the faithful who, like all Gazans, are fighting for survival amid Israeli strikes and food shortages.

title: 'Traitor' Manuel Valls to manage France's overseas territories in surprise political comeback
summary: The former Socialist turned Macron supporter, whose 'somewhat kamikaze personality' was hailed by PM François Bayrou, was chosen for his expertise on New Caledonia and, more broadly, for his experience in crisis management.

title: Syrians condemn presence of Israeli army and forced displacements in the Golan Heights
summary: Since the fall of Syrian dictator Bashar al-Assad on December 8, the Israeli army has moved into the buffer zone between the two countries, for the first time since 1974, when a disengagement deal was signed.

title: The fifteen best Yule logs of 2024
summary: All vanilla or intensely chocolatey, meringue or ice cream, praline or fruit? Here are our favorite versions of this must-have dessert for end-of-year meals.

title: Twenty not-to-be-missed shows in Paris and beyond this December
summary: Theater, opera, dance, comedy, circus, storytelling, puppetry: Le Monde's critics have selected the performances to book for the end of the year.

title: Romania's prime minister is reappointed, but political crisis persists
summary: The Social Democrat Marcel Ciolacu has been reappointed to head a government of pro-European orientation, despite a sharp decline in his party's performance in the recent general election.

title: American Airlines resumes flights after Christmas Eve ground stop due to 'technical issue'
summary: A technical issue forced the world's largest carrier to ground all its US flights for an hour on Tuesday, officials said. Flights have now resumed.

title: Germany far-right party AfD holds march after Christmas market attack
summary: Anti-extremist initiative 'Don't Give Hate a Chance' was also gathering nearby in Magdeburg, the site of Friday's carnage.

title: Design: Four must-see exhibitions in Paris as the year ends
summary: In December, come and explore five Parisian galleries to discover Ron Arad's homage to Jean Prouvé, the work of post-war French designers and exquisite Japanese wickerwork.

title: In this family, four generations have made a living from Christmas trees
summary: The Bonorons have worked their land since 1958. They discuss how their trade has evolved, from the introduction of mechanization in the 1990s to competition from artificial trees.

title: Israel wants to double the population on the Golan Heights, occupied since 1967
summary: The Israeli government has approved a development plan worth almost €10 million to encourage the colonization of this Syrian territory, conquered in the 1967 war and annexed in 1981.

title: Two reporters killed and others injured in gang shootout in Haiti capital
summary: According to initial reports, assailants opened fire at a hospital in Port-au-Prince as journalists covered the reopening of the clinic. In early December, nearly 200 people were killed in a massacre led by a gang leader, according to the United Nations and a local NGO.

title: From a Paris suburb to NASA: How young aerospace engineer Allan Petre shot for the stars
summary: Petre joined the US space agency in January 2023. From a modest background, he followed his passion – space – and set his sights very high – NASA – while refusing to back down.

title: French Far right rejoices after party's bête noire denied Ministry of Justice
summary: Ever since Xavier Bertrand's candidacy for the Ministry of Justice was first mooted, the Rassemblement National has voiced criticism of the man they consider to be one of their worst political enemies.

title: A lack of trust that goes unnoticed between Poland and Ukraine
summary: Although Warsaw is still Kyiv's first advocate in its aspirations to join the European Union and NATO, behind the scenes relations are tense, particularly around the memory of the Volhynia massacre.

title: Who really was Jesus of Nazareth? The never-ending quest for the historical Jesus
summary: God incarnate, rabbi, mystic: who really was Jesus? Since the beginning of critical studies on the Gospels, hundreds of researchers have tried to read between the legends to determine the historical contours of the founder of Christianity.

title: Impeached South Korean president defies Christmas summons
summary: President Yoon Suk Yeol, a former prosecutor, also failed to attend a hearing he was summoned to last Wednesday, not explaining his absence. Yoon faces impeachment and criminal charges of insurrection, which could result in life imprisonment or even the death penalty.

title: Bashar al-Assad, Putin's refugee
summary: Since the fall of his regime, the Syrian dictator has joined family and relatives who were already in Russia. For years, the Assad clan has been transferring and investing a large amount of money in Moscow.

title: Kazakhstan says 42 people likely dead in Azerbaijan Airlines' plane crash
summary: Kazakhstan's emergency ministry said 67 people were on board the Embraer 190 aircraft.

title: The complex challenge of rebuilding Mayotte after Cyclone Chido
summary: Rehousing inhabitants of shantytowns, securing access to land and materials, navigating building regulations... Rebuilding the French Indian Ocean territory raises countless questions.

title: Belgian pop star Angèle spreads her wings
summary: She undoubtedly left her mark on 2024 with her captivating performance of 'Nightcall' alongside Phoenix and Kavinsky at the Olympic Games closing ceremony. The 29-year-old artist had come out of her last triumphant tour in September 2023 feeling exhausted. She is now working on her third album, with a new perspective.

title: Six flowers in pots or bouquets for Christmas gifts
summary: Far less expensive than a piece of jewelry, but just as precious, these six slightly frosty varieties are perfect as last-minute gifts. Or as a spectacular bouquet, so you don't arrive empty-handed on New Year's Eve.

title: Zelensky condemns Russian 'inhumane' Christmas attack on energy grid
summary: Russia launched over 170 missiles and drones on the country's power grid on Christmas Day, killing an energy worker.

title: Pope calls for 'arms to be silenced' in Christmas message
summary: Francis used his traditional Urbi et Orbi message to call for talks for a just peace in Ukraine, Sudan and the Middle East.

title: In Brazil, donkeys are slaughtered to produce a remedy for traditional Chinese medicine
summary: Since 2018, an average of 38,600 donkeys have been killed each year, leading to a 60% reduction in the population between 2018 and 2023. The species is now threatened with extinction in the country.

title: Miraculous rescue of 11-year-old in the Mediterranean moves Italy
summary: A sailing boat operated by an NGO discovered the shipwreck survivor by chance in the middle of the night, while humanitarian efforts are being deliberately obstructed by Giorgia Meloni's far-right government.

title: France and Mexico's tug-of-war over restitution of Aztec and Mayan treasures
summary: An indigenous Mexican nation has written to the Assemblée Nationale seeking the return of its codex, arguing that the centuries-old manuscript describes traditions it still continues. Radical-left lawmakers have promised to support the request, which has been rejected by Paris in the past.

title: Syria monitor says 9 dead in clashes over attempted arrest of Assad-era officer
summary: An HTS official confirmed to AFP that clashes erupted between the new authorities' security forces and supporters of the former government in Tartus province – a stronghold of former leader Bashar al-Assad's Alawite minority

title: More than 1,500 prisoners escape in Mozambique amid post-election unrest
summary: Among those attempting to escape, 33 were killed and 15 wounded in clashes with prison staff, said national police chief Bernardino Rafael at a press conference.
